Pre-Game Insights: Bangladesh will fight to stay alive in the T20 World Cup 2024 when they take on India in their second Super Eight clash in Antigua.
India have relied on Suryakumar Yadav to steer them out of a wobble in both games so far, putting pressure on Shivam Dube to perform as the spin enforcer.
Against a quality spin attack, Saturday will possibly be another stern test for Bangladesh's batters.
Bangladesh's batters haven't given their spinners enough cushion so far in the tournament, making the task tougher against India.
India's fully-fit Hardik Pandya gives them the flexibility needed to play either a third seamer or a third spinner in Kuldeep Yadav.
There's always the extra edge this rivalry has gained in recent times, with significant moments in 2015, 2016, and 2018.
Ravindra Jadeja has only bowled three overs in the tournament and has batted twice, scoring 0 and 7.
Tanzid Hasan's form is a concern; Bangladesh's only other batting option is Soumya Sarkar, whose form hasn't been promising either.
Bangladesh captain Najmul Hossain Shanto isn't able to understand why they're struggling with the bat.
